text: now across the globe countries whose
healthcare systems are buckling under
the corona virus pandemic are turning to
Cuba for help since the start of the
crisis Cuba has sent more than 1,200
doctors and nurses to the frontlines in
22 countries most have arrived into
vulnerable African and Caribbean allies
of Cuba including Venezuela Jamaica and
Nicaragua but also richer nations
including Italy in China South Africa is
the latest country to receive at Cuba's
help these pictures were sent from an
air bus in Pretoria on Sunday the Cuban
doctors are being welcomed by the
government and members of the Cuban
community around 200 medical staff are
helping South Africa's health system
there and for decades in fact Cuba has
sent its doctors abroad winning friends
in remote countries but also filling a
desperate need state media tells us more
than 400,000 health care workers have
been sent abroad since 1963 often seen
as icons of Cuba's socialist solidarity
while some are sent on humanitarian
grounds many are paying for their
service The Economist says medical
exports make up 46 percent of the
islands export earnings to put that into
context for you
Cuba earned 6.3 billion pounds dollars
even for medical services in 2018 that's
twice as much as it earned on tourism
while it is a major source of income it
offers an even bigger prize diplomatic
prestige we found these pictures from
Italy last month take a look
doctors nurses receiving a hero's
welcome as they arrived in Lombardy the
pictures were posted by a pro cuban
revolution group in italy italy was the
first developed european nation to
accept Cuba's help during this pandemic
and while many held them heroes critics
believe Cuba's real interests are
economic and diplomatic the u.s. is a

said the following
Cuba's deployment of medical missions
overseas while cloaked in altruism is
actually a scheme to generate income
that exploits Cuba medical workers they
went on to say Cuba's medical missions
program is not inherently humanitarian
the regime earned income by retaining up
to 90% of the doctors salaries well The

media suggest Cuba has as many as a
hundred thousand doctors or nine
physicians for every thousand citizens
it's free health care system is
considered a pillar of the revolution
success
Reuters described it as renowned for its

and shut schools early when the country
still only had around 21 confirmed cases
but other factors make Cuba vulnerable
the country has the oldest population in
the Americas more than twenty percent
